page.title: 11HOUSING IN MADELEY
page.content: In Madeley we have several houses of importance, mostly listed buildings. These include the Old Hall, The Alms- houses and the Jacobean House. Besides these there is a large selection of old houses, mainly around the Church and along the Holborn. There are now sev- eral large estates, which have caused the village population to grow consid- erably. In 1921, Madeley's first council house estate, Knightley, was built in the form of a cross. There are thirty-six houses. The next estate, Known as the Moss Estate, was begun in 1957. Many of the houses near the railway line were built -Cornish style-by the National Coal Board for miners coming to this area from Durham and Northumberland. There are also three modern estates; one of bungalows built in 1966,one soon after- wards, and one set among trees later.
